member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Mobile.MobileModelWidgetBase.ClientEvents
member.summary:
Set implementations of client events raised by a widget.
Event handler assumes 2 parameters: 1st parameter has name "evt" and 2nd parameter has name "ui". To get information about member variables available for "ui" parameter, please consult documentation of a widget and its events.
Examples:
1. Full implementation:
new Dictionary<string, string> { { "dropDownOpening", "function(evt,ui){alert('drop:'+ui.owner);}" } }
2. Content of inline function:
new Dictionary<string, string> { { "dropDownOpening", "alert('drop:'+ui.owner);" } }
3. Name of global function:
new Dictionary<string, string> { { "dropDownOpening", "nameOfGlobalFunction" } } Note:
Instead of explicit key-strings, which represent name of event exposed by a widget, the event-constants defined by a particular control can be used.
Example:
new Dictionary<string, string> { { ComboClientEvents.DropDownOpening, "nameOfGlobalFunction" } }

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Mobile.InfragisticsMobileSuite`1.CheckBoxGroup(Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Mobile.CheckBoxGroupModel)

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Mobile.InfragisticsMobileSuite`1.CheckBoxGroup(System.String)
member.summary:
Helper to configure a CheckBoxGroup for name.
Notes:
Values checked on client will persist after postback.
However, if in view the Checked property of CheckBox was set to true or to false, then that will have priority over checked state coming from client.
In order to maintain persistence of client value, the model of application should have named field/property "id" with type of int[] or string[].
If application sets IDs of CheckBoxes, then type will be string[] and it will contain IDs of Checked checkboxes, otherwise, type will be int[] and it will contain indexes of Checked checkboxes.
member.param: ID of control and name of field.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Mobile.InfragisticsMobileSuite`1.CheckBoxGroupFor``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}})
member.summary:
Helper to configure a CheckBoxGroup widget for a specific property of the model.
Notes:
Values checked on client will persist after postback.
However, if in view the Checked property of CheckBox was set to true or to false, then that will have priority over checked state coming from client.
The model of application should have named field/property with type of int[] or string[].
If application sets IDs of CheckBoxes, then type will be string[] and it will contain IDs of Checked checkboxes, otherwise, type will be int[] and it will contain indexes of Checked checkboxes.
member.param: The expression for a property of the model.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Mobile.InfragisticsMobileSuite`1.RadioButtonGroup(System.String)
member.summary:
Helper to configure a RadioButtonGroup for name.
Notes:
In order to maintain persistence of client value, the model of application should have named field/property "id" with type of int or string.

member.summary:
Helper to configure a RadioButtonGroup for name.
Notes:
In order to maintain persistence of client value, the model of application should have named field/property "id" with type of string.
member.param: ID of control and name of field.
The ID of initially selected item. If RadioButton item does not have ID, then string-index-of-item should be used.

member.summary:
Helper to configure a RadioButtonGroup widget for a specific property of the model.
Notes:
The model of application should have named field/property with type string.
If a RadioButton item has missing ID, then while persistence, the string which contain index of item is used.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Mobile.InfragisticsMobileSuite`1.SelectMenu(System.String,Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Mobile.SelectMenuModel)
member.summary:
Helper to configure and render SelectMenu.
Notes:
Values selected on client will persist after postback.
However, if in SelectMenuModel the Selected property of SelectMenuItem was set to true or to false, then that will have priority over selection coming from client.
In order to maintain persistence of client values, the model of application should have named field/property "id" with type of string or string[], which contains Value(s) of selected item(s).

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Mobile.ListViewDataSourceActionAttribute
member.summary: this is an attribute class which extends the mvc FilterAttribute. It should be put on top of the controller method that should return JSON (even though in the user code it will return Action Result). The idea of this filter is to transform the ActionResult into a JsonResult instance, taking into account all Request params such as paging, sorting, and filtering. Since MVC doesn't have ViewState, we will need to infer all the features from the request itself, that's the only information we have regarding any previous state.

member.summary: intercepts the controller call, and transforms the action result into a json result.

member.summary: implementation of the ActionExecuting event
